{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3524509,"name":"","username":"snprime","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/snprime/{size}/120580_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-12T05:31:49.593Z","cooked":"

My team is having a weird problem that I’ve never seen before. We are running a standard Rev SwerveMax swerve drive and the NEOs are running fine, but two of our 550s turn from blue when disabled to purple/orange when we enable the robot. Like we would expect, the NEOs work just fine and the two 550s who controllers go red/green work as well, while the other two 550s don’t run. We’ve checked out wiring and updated our firmware. Does anyone have any other ideas of what we can do?

docs.revrobotics.com

SPARK MAX Status LED Patterns | REV ION Brushless

image894×211 19.7 KB

This would probably a sensor fault. Are you running encoders off the sensor ports on the SparkMAX? Check to make sure they’re properly connected

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2025-02-12T05:39:32.491Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":100,"readers_count":99,"score":25.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":491328,"topic_slug":"neo-550-blinks-blue-and-then-goes-to-purple-and-orange","display_username":"Matthew K","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.revrobotics.com/brushless/spark-max/status-led","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"SPARK MAX Status LED Patterns | REV ION Brushless","clicks":2}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55172,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"barn2robotics alumni"},"post_url":"/t/neo-550-blinks-blue-and-then-goes-to-purple-and-orange/491328/2","custom_user_title":"barn2robotics alumni","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3524864,"name":"","username":"snprime","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/snprime/{size}/120580_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-12T16:37:21.173Z","cooked":"

Yeah, we’ve checked and rechecked that our encoders are correct and that our wiring is correct. We’ve eliminated wiring as a problem and don’t have any mechanical errors (not that a mechanical error would cause a fault in the controller anyway, but for completeness sake). We’ll replace the motor controllers if we have to, but that will be a giant pain in the butt and I wanted to see if anyone has any other ideas first.
